metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1693 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
browser/safe_browsing/srt_field_trial_win.cc in Google Chrome before 51.0.2704.63 does not use the HTTPS service on dl.google.com to obtain the Software Removal Tool, which allows remote attackers to spoof the chrome_cleanup_tool.exe (aka CCT) file via a man-in-the-middle attack on an HTTP session.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1693` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1121').
